alert.note: Alert for Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:18AM EDT until April 08 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania...including the following county...Lehigh. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain fell last night. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain fell. - For Little Lehigh at Trexlertown near Little Lehigh Creek: At 5:15am the stage was 4.69 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. ... For Spring Creek at Trexlertown at Spring Creek: At 5:30am the stage was 4.38 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. ... For Little Lehigh at Allentown: At 5:30am the stage was 4.15 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 55 and 60. Northeast Extension between mile markers 53 and 56. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
